list: Protects surfaces from paint and debris
Double stitched seams for lasting durability

reviews.title: "Buyer beware worst product ever"
reviews.text: Beware...This will leave stains on your carpet and bleed thru.  Good luck dealing with this manufacture to make it right.
reviews.author: KJ

reviews.title: "Great For A Curtain Panel ... No Sewing Required!"
reviews.text: You Can See In The Pictures That We Used These For Curtain Panels.  I Just Folded Over At The Top To Give It A Valance Look And Used The Clips To Hang These On PLASTIC PVC Pipe!  My Husband Cut The PVC Pipe And Then Spray Painted Brown.  He Used The Plastic Schedule 40/90' ELL 3/4"  To Make It Flush With The Wall.  These Turned Out Great!  And Not Too Expensive, But Gives The Room A Great Look!
reviews.author: Cheryl

reviews.title: "Center seams"
reviews.text: When buying for decor, I'll go with Home Depot's brand, everbuilt. We bought both brands to compare. Everbuilt pictures on left (more gray, no seam, stiffer fabric before wash). Painters Pride on right (seam right down the middle, more tan, fabric has no stiffness before wash, making me feel it is of lighter weight). Both bought were advertised 8oz weight.
reviews.author: Renae

reviews.title: "Cloth Drop Cloth Review"
reviews.text: what i really like of this type of drop cloth is the many uses that i have used this product, i have used it as a drop cloth, i have used it as a furniture cover, i have used it as a wood floor cover and every time it has saved me lots of clean up work.
reviews.author: RobBusta

reviews.title: "life saver"
reviews.text: so much easier than plastic and won't rip under the ladder. Boxer dog approved
reviews.author: T

reviews.text: We bought the 6 by 9 drop cloth when we got it home and opened it it was actually 4 foot by 9 foot
reviews.author: Worker

reviews.title: "Bad Smell"
reviews.text: This drop cloth stunk so bad we could not keep it in the house. It has been a month and it is still out in my shop airing out. I would not even give it to my enemies!
reviews.author: Greg

reviews.title: "Pinterest Curtain Fail"
reviews.text: I have made curtains with the Hone Depot brand canvas cloth and those are beautiful...these are a waste of money and are uneven also have a large seam in the middle both (I bought two cloths) are going in separate directions. Honestly really the only thing they are good for is covering your floor. I'll be back at Home Depot for my next canvas purchase. I do not recommend this product for anything other than a drop cloth.
reviews.author: Amom

reviews.title: "You know you are going to drip"
reviews.text: I've used newspapers, old sheets, plastic, and tarps.  The easiest remains the good old canvas.  Great for painting and just lasts forever.
reviews.author: Ed

reviews.title: "Not Good for Decorating"
reviews.text: I bought this intending to use it for a tablecloth.  It has a prominent seam lengthwise down the middle.  I could live with that, as I planned to place a table runner over it anyway.  However, it's definitely not 100% cotton.  The package doesn't list the material content, but it's quite stretchy, as if it contains spandex.  Whatever the content, it shrank unevenly after machine washing and drying.  And make no mistake, it DOES shrink.  Even after meticulous ironing, it is warped, mis-shapen and puckery in places.  It looks like there are 12-inch wide bands of elastic woven into it, causing it to draw up unevenly.  It won't lay flat for anything.  This also causes the hem line to slant.  So if you're looking to decorate with this, keep looking.  It might work for curtains, where the uneven shape could be disguised in the folds.  But if you need it to lay flat, this one gets a big fat, "NO" vote.  I may use it to make slipcovers for some throw pillows.
reviews.author: brkornhaus

reviews.title: "Not Even Close to 6x9"
reviews.text: One of the few that i bought was 8' long. Others were 8'4”. None were 9'
reviews.author: Lumberjack

reviews.title: "Super durable drop cloth"
reviews.text: Used this for painting and our garage sale to place out furniture on.
reviews.author: Munky

reviews.title: "Like"
reviews.text: Using as a protective barrier in back of SUV. Keeps dirty greasy items from staining rear carpet. Does a good job. Good price.
reviews.author: TD

reviews.title: "Not true to size!"
reviews.text: Description read 9x6. It was actually 8 x5'3”. I was using this product as a curtain. Very disappointing!!!!!!
reviews.author: Pam

reviews.title: "Way better than expected"
reviews.text: It's a drop cloth and really inexpensive yet it's truly excellent material, I used to stencil and upholster chairs, much better quality than way more expensive fabrics.
reviews.author: truthful

reviews.title: "Just annoying."
reviews.text: My wife bought three of these before to make curtain out of them. Two of them were perfect and matched. The third had a seem that ran horizontal instead of vertical like the other two. We went and bought a different one hoping to get one to match the others and once again it was vertical instead of horizontal like she needed. They should make all of them the same to alleviate these issues.
reviews.author: Bryan

reviews.title: "Greatest drop cloth ever. You can reuse it!"
reviews.text: It's tge greatest drop cloth ever. You can use it over and over again. You can also it it on a rug for tragic control while refurbishing a Home. Lay it down to walk over clean areas while under construction. I had several carpenters tell me I was a very smart woman for using this drop cloth to protect the rug from sanding, painting, from dirty feet. Trust me it the best drop cloth ever❣️
reviews.author: Von

reviews.title: "Never buying plastic again!"
reviews.text: I never wanted to spend the money on something that was just going to get paint on it, but this was such a great price that I figured I'd try it and I'm glad I did! It's durable and a great size. We're giving the inside of our house a “face lift” and repainting everything, so we just throw it in the washer as needed instead of buying more plastic drop cloths. Highly recommend!
reviews.author: jamield79

reviews.title: "Wanted: quality control on measurements"
reviews.text: I can't review durability for painting as I bought this for a wedding shower backdrop. One cloth measured 6x9 and the other was 5x8, so some rigging was needed after hanging to complete the project (a base was drilled to a block wall so no chance of moving that to accommodate the mismatched lengths and making more holes, lol).
reviews.author: Melodie

reviews.title: "Better than plastic"
reviews.text: I always seem to fight the plastic drops.  This is much easier; the only downside is that stepping on a drip, or a significant amount falling on the drop will bleed through.  At least the paint will dry so you don't step on it and track it across the house...  I'll take one drip clean up over a clumsy footprint anyday.
reviews.author: Tim

reviews.title: "Disappointed crafter"
reviews.text: Purchased 10 of these 6x9 drop cloths to make curtains for my daughter's home. I opened the first package to find the 6' ends were hemmed, the 9' edges were raw, and there was a seam right down the middle. Thinking this must be a fluke, I opened and checked 3 more with same result. I will be returning them all today.
reviews.author: Jazzy

reviews.title: "Canvas drop cloth"
reviews.text: Using 4 of these drop cloths as curtains for back patio. Fits well. However, after hanging them up I noticed that the seams that run through the middle weren't identical on them. One panel has a vertical seam and the other has a horizontal seam. Not a big deal if I would use them for it's intended purpose.
reviews.author: AJ

reviews.title: "Drop Curtan"
reviews.text: This drop cloth was the perfect touch to my den.  With some sewing and refitting they provided the right texture and look that we were looking for. And now when its time to repaint, I'll have the protection necessary for the job.  Thanks Lowe's for having what we need to build, remodel and decorate.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Canvas drop cloth"
reviews.text: Worked perfectly when repainting our outdoor furniture and didn't want to overspray on the landscaping rock. Used plastic last time and just a tiny bit of wind had it flying everywhere. The canvas was nice and heavy and did what I wanted it to do and I can reuse it numerous times in the future.
reviews.author: DJ

reviews.title: "Quick economical wall covering"
reviews.text: I used this product to cover the insulated studded walls in my laundry room.  It made an improvement over the paper backed insulation in the room and was easy enough for me to handle and hang using a staple gun.  Wires and pipes will be easily accessible if need be.
reviews.author: myzoe

reviews.title: "Very useful"
reviews.text: Are use these drop Klos very frequently they are very useful I haven't had paint suit through them or anything generally easy to clean off and just the right size to throw out for almost any project
reviews.author: Castlepro

reviews.title: "Great Dropcloths!"
reviews.text: Painters Pride dropcloths are durable and great to use for many things other than painting.  Great neutral color and perfect canvas weight and size and are also reusable and washable!
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Affordable and useful product!"
reviews.text: I purchased this because I was painting a chandelier and was happy how large the blanket was. Softer and thicker than I expected. Very good size blanket and material  for the price!
reviews.author: jay

reviews.title: "Canvas drop cloth"
reviews.text: The canvas drop cloth is a good size for small to medium jobs. I used this canvas drop cloth when restoring my patio furniture. Good protection for the concrete floor.
reviews.author: Hank

reviews.title: "2nd purchase"
reviews.text: LOVE THESE. Great price and quality. Will always be my go too ... shoot I even recycled them made curtains out of a set that was used to paint the rooms with. CUTE!
reviews.author: MARQ

reviews.title: "Great drop cloth, or curtain"
reviews.text: Great as a drop cloth, much better than the plastic version.  Stays in place much better than plastic and is reusable.  We even used one as a curtain in our camper.
reviews.author: Shaun

reviews.title: "Canvas Drop Cloth"
reviews.text: Needed something to put on customer's floors when repairing power wheelchairs. This product works well and was less expensive that moving pads/bankets.
reviews.author: PapaBear

reviews.title: "Excellent & easy to handle"
reviews.text: Found this to be extremely effective at preventing paint bleed through as well I as being lightweight manageable, and easy to clean. Highly recommended
reviews.author: Doug

reviews.title: "A Great Lightweight Drop Cloth"
reviews.text: I've been very satisfied with this drop Cloth.  It's perfect for indoor use.  Lightweight, but gives nice floor coverage when painting interior walls.
reviews.author: GJFH1

reviews.title: "No issues"
reviews.text: great price, size is what I needed and no complaints.  thin but not so thin that the paint I spilled leaked through to the floor it was protecting :)
reviews.author: jg

reviews.title: "Canvas cloth"
reviews.text: Does what its supposed to do...the only downside...you actually have to use it! I spilled paint on this and it didn't seep through into my carpet.
reviews.author: Suzie

reviews.title: "Great drop cloth"
reviews.text: Stays in place well and protected my hardwood floors while I was sanding and painting.
reviews.author: Jaimie

reviews.title: "Nice cloths for a good price"
reviews.text: These did the job. I actually used them as outdoor curtains from my pergola. Holding up well. A nice versatile item.
reviews.author: KH

reviews.title: "short"
reviews.text: Its not 6 feet wide. Its only four feet wide, Does work good in keeping debris off your car when pressure washing.
reviews.author: Sid

reviews.title: "Painting Canvas Drop Cloth"
reviews.text: I am a messy painter and this fit the bill for sure.  It protected my newly carpeted rooms from paint spills.
reviews.author: Catherine

reviews.title: "Does the job"
reviews.text: Great for small areas, only issue was a musty smell of the cloth so after a quick wash no more musty smell
reviews.author: Cat

reviews.title: "Worked good"
reviews.text: This is a drop cloth so it's nothing special but was nice that it didn't stink like others I have bought.
reviews.author: Ben

reviews.title: "Everyday use"
reviews.text: You can use it for everything. I sure do! This is an easy clean up tool that eliminates time and effort.
reviews.author: Alex

reviews.title: "Painters canvas"
reviews.text: This canvas is an excellent choice for floors-furniture to be protected from paint spills and spatters.
reviews.author: Deb

reviews.title: "Clothe"
reviews.text: I used these cloth to cover floors and cover plant outside when the temperature drop below freezing.
reviews.author: Will

reviews.text: did not stop stain or paint that dripped - is not coated on one side like the last one I purchased
reviews.author: ernie

reviews.title: "Great Drop Cloth for the Price"
reviews.text: Would buy again has worked great for painting the house. Much better than plastic in my opinion.
reviews.author: jordan1234

reviews.title: "Real Drop Cloth...."
reviews.text: When it has to stand up to Real Work & be Durable to Last Canvas is the Answer Not Plastic..
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Canvas drop cloth"
reviews.text: We bought the whole box (16). Returned them the next day. The whole box had an awful odor.
reviews.author: BigRigg

reviews.title: "Perfect for your DIY paint jobs."
reviews.text: Great size and great price. Used it for some work I did on my cabinets. Highly recommend.
reviews.author: Sam

reviews.title: "Great Value"
reviews.text: Perfect size and just the right price for the drop cloth I needed to paint bedroom walls.
reviews.author: piedmont

reviews.title: "They work"
reviews.text: They work. They are fairly inexpensice. They can be washed and used again and again.
reviews.author: Brian

reviews.title: "Great for Painting and other chores!"
reviews.text: This item is an adequate size particularly for painting. I highly recommend it.
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Great Drop Cloth"
reviews.text: This drop cloth is great  for reusing for many projects!No more plastic !
reviews.author: BB

reviews.title: "Perfect for what we needed"
reviews.text: We used them as table cloths for a rustic wedding at they worked perfectly!
reviews.author: D

reviews.title: "Great product for the price"
reviews.text: The drop cloth worked great, didn't experience any paint soaking through.
reviews.author: Nate

reviews.title: "Does what its suppose  to do...catch drippings and"
reviews.text: Does what its suppose  to do...catch drippings and spills with no leakage
reviews.author: Jacques

reviews.title: "Canvas cloth"
reviews.text: This drop cloth lets moisture through. Not sure how it would stop paint.
reviews.author: jag

reviews.title: "Drop Cloth"
reviews.text: Very easy to handle Not super bulky. Works well for my painting needs
reviews.author: Jocko

reviews.title: "Great size for small jobs"
reviews.text: This drop cloth is great for home use. A great size and easy to handle
reviews.author: Guitarzan

reviews.title: "Keeping the kitchen clean!"
reviews.text: Excellent dropcloth! Heavy enough not to slide around. Worked great!
reviews.author: Doc

reviews.title: "Painter's Pride 8-oz Canvas 6-ft x 9-ft Drop Cloth"
reviews.text: Great Product, great quality, as always in products offered @ Lowes
reviews.author: Fred

reviews.title: "Painter's cloth"
reviews.text: Very good material.  Easy to handle. Will be around for a longtime.
reviews.author: MAG

reviews.title: "Drop Cloths"
reviews.text: Smaller size for smaller areas - great help with messy jobs!
reviews.author: April

reviews.title: "It's a drop cloth"
reviews.text: It's a drop cloth that does it's job for a reasonable price.
reviews.author: TNT

reviews.title: "Living room curtains"
reviews.text: LOVE THIS FARMHOUSE APPEAL THESE GIVE TO OUR LIVINGROOM!
reviews.author: Kim

reviews.title: "Easy to use"
reviews.text: Catches what doesn't make it to the walls or ceilings
reviews.author: Nfieden

reviews.text: Worked great. Laid flat an kept  paint off the floor.
reviews.author: Myronjoe

reviews.title: "Canvas Drop Cloth"
reviews.text: This drop cloth did the trick! Sturdy and protective.
reviews.author: Rambuba

reviews.title: "Great price"
reviews.text: This has been a handy tool for my painting projects.
reviews.author: Casey

reviews.title: "Drop cloth"
reviews.text: Nicely stays down, soft enough to adjust placement

questions.question: "Is this with stitching directly down the middle?   I need without that.."
questions.author: JonnyBear

answers.author: Julie
answers.text: Yes it does have a seam down the middle of it.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this does not have stitching directly down the middle.

questions.question: "Are 4' x 9' canvas drop cloths seamless? Or could they be pieces sewn together to make the correct size? Need a solid piece of canvas that size.."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Jazzy
answers.text: You will get a seam up the middle and raw edges

questions.question: "Can canvas be cut and sewed? I'm a crafter, and will be using it for that purpose."
questions.author: Pam

answers.author: Keke
answers.text: Yes I have made bed skirt curtains and shower curtains from them. They also dye well with Ritz dye products.
